page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN CURY/GUNWALLOE
page.content: There are two minor roads that pass through the area. One leaves the main Helston/Lizard Road (A3083) near the R.N.A.S Culdrose Sportsfields and goes through Berepper/Gunwalloe terminating at Church Cove. No through road except for cars which can cross a sandy path across Mullion Golf Course and connect with the other road which goes through to Mullion and the Lizard.This other road leaves the A3083 at Mainlay and passes through the village of Cury. The villages of Berepper/Gunwalloe have no Public Transport and rely entirely on private transport. The village of Cury is more fortunate in having a through service from Helston to the Lizard and return. This service comprises of three coaches a day. Owing to schedules available many residents use their own transport for convenience.
